page.title: 19HEALTH - BORDEAN HOUSE (2)
page.content: The establishment was originally run by nuns, but when financial difficulties arose, they approached Lady Ryder, who accepted the task of making the house comply to fire regulations. An agreement was also made with Portsmouth Hospital, who wanted Bordean House to put aside some of the beds for their cancer patients. The house is leased to Lady Ryder and some nuns still live there along with a priest who runs the Catholic/Church of England chapel. Every week a mobile library visits for the residents. A shop facility is also offered by the W.R.V.S twice a week. Also, a bus service occasionally takes the willing residents to the nearest town-Petersfield. All the inmates are very happy to be there. {
